result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Allan J Lehman

records.addlTxt: Initial Appearance set for 11/07/22 @ 1:30 p.m. in Br 1

Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription. 
Do not possess any drug paraphernalia. 
Do not associate with any persons possessing or consuming illegal controlled substances.

1:12 PM Defendant Allan J Lehman appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Jedidiah J Dodge in court for State of WI. Attorney (Atty) Taylor Soule is present in court.
Assistant District Attorney (ADA)  Dodge states facts for anticipated charges of Possession of Methamphetamine. 
Attorney for the defendant does not have anything to state about the facts of the case.
Court finds probable cause that a crime has been committed and that this defendant committed it.
Court informs defendant of right to an attorney and/or public defender.
State requests a signature bond with conditions as stated. 
Attorney for the defendant does not have any objections as to bond.
Bail/bond hearing scheduled for November 7, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
